contentrichtext.text: {{BLP sources|date=September 2009}} {{Infobox astronaut | name = Vladimir Viktorovich Aksyonov | image = 1980. Союз-Т2. Ю.В. Малышев, В.В. Аксенов.jpg | caption = [[Yury Vasilyevich Malyshev|Yury Malyshev]] (left) and Vladimir Aksyonov (right) on a 1980 [[postage stamp]] | type = Cosmonaut | nationality = [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1935|2|1}} | birth_place = [[Kasimovsky District|Giblitsy]], [[USSR]] | occupation = [[Aviator|Pilot]] | selection = {{nobr|[[List of astronauts by selection#1973|Civilian Specialist Group 5]]}} | time = 11d 20h 11m | mission = [[Soyuz 22]], [[Soyuz T-2]] | awards = {{Hero of the Soviet Union}} {{Order of Lenin}} | insignia = }} '''Vladimir Viktorovich Aksyonov''' (Влади́мир Ви́кторович Аксёнов) (born in [[Kasimovsky District|Giblitsy]], [[Kasimovsky District]], [[Ryazan Oblast]], [[Russian SFSR]] on February 1, 1935) is a Soviet cosmonaut, married with two children.<ref>[http://spacefacts.de/bios/cosmonauts/english/aksyonov_vladimir.htm Spacefacts.de]</ref> He graduated from institute of Engineering with diploma and graduated from Air Force Institute and graduated from polytechnical Institute. He was a candidate technical science. Selected as [[cosmonaut]] on March 3, 1973. Vladimir Aksyonov was awarded the title of the [[Hero of the Soviet Union]] on two occasions. Retired on October 17, 1988. Flew as Flight Engineer on [[Soyuz 22]] and [[Soyuz T-2]]. He is currently director of the institute for research of mineral resources. ==Honours and awards== {{Russian|Аксёнов, Владимир Викторович}} * "[[Gold Star]]" [[Hero of the Soviet Union]], twice (1976, 1980) * Two [[Orders of Lenin]] (1976, 1980) * [[Medal "For Merit in Space Exploration"]] (12 April 2011) - for the great achievements in the field of research, development and utilization of outer space, many years of diligent work, public activities * [[Medal "Veteran of Labour"]] * Gold medal "For services to science and humanity" (Czechoslovakia) * [[Order of Karl Marx]] (East Germany, 13 October 1976) * [[Pilot-Cosmonaut of the USSR]] * Honoured Master of Sports * Honorary Citizen of [[Ryazan]] ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Persondata | NAME = Aksyonov, Vladimir | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Soviet cosmonaut, engineer | DATE OF BIRTH = February 1, 1935 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[Kasimovsky District|Giblitsy]], [[Russia]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Aksyonov, Vladimir}} [[Category:1935 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Kasimovsky District]] [[Category:Communist Party of the Soviet Union rank-and-file]] [[Category:Soviet cosmonauts]] [[Category:Double Heroes of the Soviet Union]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Lenin, twice]] [[Category:Recipients of the Medal For Merit in Space Exploration]] [[Category:Recipients of the Order of Karl Marx]] [[Category:Pilot-Cosmonauts of the USSR]] [[Category:Soviet engineers]] {{Russia-bio-stub}} {{astronaut-stub}}
